TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ThreadPoolExecutor extends Java.Util.Concurrent.AbstractExecutorService

Docs.summary: An that executes each submitted task using one of possibly several pooled threads, normally configured using factory methods.

Docs.param: true if should time out, else false
Docs.summary: Sets the policy governing whether core threads may time out and terminate if no tasks arrive within the keep-alive time, being replaced if needed when new tasks arrive.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if value is true and the current keep-alive time is not greater than zero

Docs.summary: Returns true if this pool allows core threads to time out and terminate if no tasks arrive within the keepAlive time, being replaced if needed when new tasks arrive.

Docs.param: the desired time unit of the result
Docs.summary: Returns the thread keep-alive time, which is the amount of time that threads in excess of the core pool size may remain idle before being terminated.

Docs.param: the time to wait. A time value of zero will cause excess threads to terminate immediately after executing tasks.
the time unit of the time argument
Docs.summary: Sets the time limit for which threads may remain idle before being terminated.

Docs.exception: if time less than zero or if time is zero and allowsCoreThreadTimeOut

Docs.summary: Initiates an orderly shutdown in which previously submitted tasks are executed, but no new tasks will be accepted.

Docs.summary: Attempts to stop all actively executing tasks, halts the processing of waiting tasks, and returns a list of the tasks that were awaiting execution.
